title: Trump DOJ official says Newsom staffer, senator put target on her back
shortDescription: Harmeet Dhillon says a California Gov. Gavin Newsom staffer and Connecticut Sen. Chris Murphy put a target on her back.

title: Trump comments on furloughed workers
shortDescription: During an Oval Office meeting with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, Trump said that some furloughed workers "don't deserve" back pay.

title: Trump says some furloughed federal workers ‘don’t deserve’ back pay
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said some furloughed federal workers “don’t deserve” to receive back pay when the federal government shutdown is over.

title: Florida lawmakers debate property tax
shortDescription: A House panel began a review of property taxes as it examines potential changes that could have a significant impact on local governments.

title: Will Trump pardon Diddy, Ghislaine Maxwell? Here is what he said
shortDescription: President Donald Trump was asked Oct. 6 about the possibility to pardon Jeffrey Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell and music mogul Sean Diddy Combs.

title: Trump calls Greta Thunberg 'so crazy'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump criticized Swedish activist Greta Thunberg for being "so crazy." The 22-year-old had a response to his comments.

title: Trump to meet the last remaining American hostage released by Hamas
shortDescription: Edan Alexander was among 251 hostages kidnapped by Hamas during the Oct. 7, 2023, terror attack.

title: Government shutdown live updates: Trump signals shift
shortDescription: Keep up with live updates from across the USA TODAY Network as the government shutdown continues.

title: What does ‘FAFO’ mean? Latest Trump acronym existed outside politics
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has used acronyms like MAGA, MAHA and DOGE. FAFO stands for 'f--- around and find out.' Hegseth said it at the military meeting

title: What to know about the Tennessee Oct. 7 primary special election
shortDescription: More than a dozen people are running in the Tennessee primary special election on Oct. 7, including President Trump's preferred pick: Matt Van Epps.

title: How the federal shutdown and DOGE cuts are rocking VA's election
shortDescription: Trump's cutbacks are top of mind for Virginia voters as Democrat Abigail Spanberger, and Republican Lt. Gov. Winsome square off.

title: Trump says 'young people of TikTok' owe him for saving the popular app
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said that young people "owe" him for saving the popular video app in his first post on TikTok in nearly a year.

title: 250 ballots went missing. Was it an Amazon delivery gone wrong?
shortDescription: Maine is investigating a claim that hundreds of blank ballots for this year's November election were delivered to a woman in her Amazon order.

title: Diddy asked Trump for a pardon, the president says
shortDescription: President Donald Trump told reporters in the Oval Office that Sean "Diddy" Combs requested a pardon after his conviction in federal sex crimes.

title: Trump says he is open to invoking Insurrection Act
shortDescription: President Donald Trump told reporters he’d invoke the Insurrection Act "if it was necessary."

title: Trump troops headed for Chicago. 'Invasion of Illinois,' gov says
shortDescription: U.S. District Judge April M. Perry is allowing the Trump administration to proceed with plans to deploy troops to Illinois, for now.

title: Trump's Guard deployments in limbo in Portland, Chicago amid suits
shortDescription: A federal judge blocked President Donald Trump from sending the National Guard to Portland, and his Chicago orders face another legal challenge.

title: Trump says he would invoke the Insurrection Act 'if it was necessary'
shortDescription: Trump said he would consider invoking the Insurrection Act to deploy the military into cities if courts block his deployment of National Guard troops.

title: Trump says he's open to extending Obamacare subsidies to end shutdown
shortDescription: Democrats expressed skepticism that Trump is actually willing to negotiate, which the White House and congressional Republicans have publicly refused.
